article.title: rMake Management
article.para: The rMake Management page is used to manage this appliance's rMake server, its associated rMake worker nodes, and the most recent builds.

sect1.title: rMake Server Management
sect1.para:
The following operations can be performed on the rMake Server by clicking the following buttons:
Start
Stop
Restart
Reset
The Reset button clears the contents of the rMake repository and database.

sect1.title: rMake Node Management
sect1.para:
The following operations can be performed on the rMake worker nodes by clicking the following buttons:
Start
Stop
Restart
Reset
Edit
The Reset button clears the cache and chroots used by each rMake worker node.
The Edit button is used to modify the following settings for each rMake worker node:

Slots -- The maximum number of packages that can be built simultaneously by the rMake worker node.
chrootLimit -- The maximum number of chroots that can be kept for future use by the rMake worker node. Once this limit is reached, old chroots will be deleted to make room for new ones.
Click Save to save changes or Cancel to revert.

sect1.title: Builds
sect1.para: Information on the most recent builds can be viewed here. The log for a particular build can be displayed by clicking View build log.
